message.content:
cs.NI, cs.IT, cs.MM, cs.SY, cs.DC

Reasoning: 
1. cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) is the most likely category as the paper deals with the design of a scheduling policy for video streaming in a wireless network formed by several users and helpers. 
2. cs.IT (Information Theory) is also likely as the paper uses a network utility maximization (NUM) problem where the network utility function is a concave and component-wise nondecreasing function of the time-averaged users' requested video quality index. 
3. cs.MM (Multimedia) is another likely category as the paper deals with adaptive video quality and helper selection. 
4. cs.SY (Systems and Control) is also possible as the paper proposes a dynamic adaptive scheme that decomposes into two building blocks: 1) adaptive video quality and helper selection (run at the user nodes); and 2) dynamic allocation of the helper-to-user transmission rates (run at the help nodes). 
5. cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) is also possible as the paper proposes a decentralized scheme to adaptively calculate the pre-buffering and re-buffering time at each user.
